page.title: 10FARMING IN WORSBROUGH
page.content: The{Elmhirst}family have been farming in this area for over 700 years.There used to be several farms owned by the Elmhirst family but now all the farms have been combined into one large farm as is the practise with farming generally.{A.O.Elmhirst}gave his son Richard the estate when he became too old to manage it himself.The farm is a mixed dairy and arable farm.They have recently begun raising{red deer}.They breed and fatten the deer which are sold as venison.Over the years Mr Elmhirst has enjoyed seeing newly born animals play around and crops maturing in his field.He dislikes crops failing especially when the cause is not known.His animals sometimes get diseases such as Ringworm ,TB. and Brucellosis.These are always distressing for the farmer when they see their animals suffer.
